Hi,
  You can get Cantera to work exclusively within cygwin on the windows=

PC platform, if you use the python module that comes with cygwin. You
need=
 to download and install the python program that comes with cygwin.
It gets=
 installed in /usr/bin. Cantera's python modules get installed
under the di=
rectory, /usr/lib/python2.3/site-packages. And, Cantera must
always invoke =
the cygwin version of python, /usr/bin/python, not the
windows version of p=
ython, c:/python2.3.


The following preprocessor to Cantera's configure sc=
ript seems to works:

CXXFLAGS=3D'-g -Wall'
export CXXFLAGS
#
USE_VISUAL_ST=
UDIO=3D'n'
export USE_VISUAL_STUDIO
#
BUILD_MATLAB_TOOLBOX=3D'n'
export BUI=
LD_MATLAB_TOOLBOX
#
LCXX_END_LIBS=3D"-lm -lstdc++"
export LCXX_END_LIBS
#
C=
ANTERA_INSTALL_DIR=3D"c:/Cantera"
export CANTERA_INSTALL_DIR
#
#
BUILD_WITH=
_F2C=3D'y'
export BUILD_WITH_F2C
#
./configure
~            

Best wishes,
=
Harry Moffat

-----Original Message-----
From: dlignell [mailto:dlignell@ya=
hoo.com] 
Sent: Friday, December 31, 2004 2:08 PM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.c=
om
Subject: [cantera] Compile 1.5.5 with Cygwin error




I am trying to bu=
ild version 1.5.5 on Windows XP.  I am using cygwin
exclusively for the bui=
ld process (fortran and c).  I believe I have run
configure correctly (I've=
 turned off the flags related to Visual
Studio).  I have Compaq Visual Fort=
an installed, but only cygwin for the
C compilers.  

When I run 'make' I k=
eep getting an error that the code is trying to run
cl.exe and cannot find =
the file.  cl.exe is the Visual C compiler I
think, which I don't have, or =
want to use.  

Can Cantera be built on Windows using just Cygwin?   

Here=
's the error:

building 'Cantera._cantera' extension
cl.exe /c /nologo /Ox =
/MD /W3 /GX /DNDEBUG -I../../build/include - Isrc
-I../clib/src -Ic:\PYTHON=
23\include -Ic:\PYTHON23 \PC
/Tpsrc/pycantera.cpp /Fobuild\temp.win32-2.3 \=
Release\src/pycantera.obj
error: command 'cl.exe' failed: No such file or d=
irectory

Thanks,
David L.
